meanings.definition: A piece of land held by an owner.
meanings.sent1: The farmer proudly owned the tenements where he grew his crops.
meanings.sent2: The city council decided to sell the tenements to different owners.
meanings.sent3: The tenements of land had a party and invited all the trees to join!
meanings.sent4: The tenements of land stood like tiny islands in the vast sea of green fields.
meanings.sent5: The tenements of land were like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.

meanings.definition: A building divided into separate residences.
meanings.sent1: The old tenements in the city were in need of repair.
meanings.sent2: Many families lived in the crowded tenements on the street corner.
meanings.sent3: The tenements on Maple Street had a race to see who could reach the top floor first!
meanings.sent4: The tenements loomed over the neighborhood like giants guarding their treasure.
meanings.sent5: The colorful doors of the tenements brightened up the gloomy alleyway.
